channel.title: Tom's Cache Suite questions
channel.description: 1. "Import/Export 3D Models" What models are these, specifically? They don't look like anything recognizable to me. 2. If those aren't item/npc models, are there any other cache editing programs that can add models for items and npcs? 3. When using a webclient, is it possible to get the client to check for a new cache, and automatically download it?

item.title: Tom's Cache Suite questions
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:4, topic:451253”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=554142.msg4058753#msg4058753 date=1343246935]

for the webclient, you put a new client.jar url link in your html code.
so you would have to resign and jar your client

I meant like changing the cachedownloader so that it checks for a new cache each time it loads
[/quote]

Isn’t that what JAGGRAB is for?[/quote]

i think so, but i have no clue how to use it

Read full topic

item.title: Tom's Cache Suite questions

for the webclient, you put a new client.jar url link in your html code.
so you would have to resign and jar your client
[/quote]

I meant like changing the cachedownloader so that it checks for a new cache each time it loads[/quote]

Isn’t that what JAGGRAB is for?

item.title: Tom's Cache Suite questions
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

  1. “Import/Export 3D Models” What models are these, specifically? They don’t look like anything recognizable to me.
  2. If those aren’t item/npc models, are there any other cache editing programs that can add models for items and npcs?
  3. When using a webclient, is it possible to get the client to check for a new cache, and automatically download it?

Read full topic
